H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3130.def: = man; ◄ eleventh son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► father of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>} and {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}, each founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H6584.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3801.def: = an undergarment, ◄ woven of linen, ► and worn by the High Priest and his fellow priests; it was worn over the {L:breeches<SDBH:מִכְנָס>}, but from the waist up it was next to the skin; it was a kind of shirt and probably had long sleeves and reached nearly to the ankles and was held in place by a sash wound around the waist.

H6446.def: = long robe with sleeves ► worn by young unmarried men and women; ≈ considered valuable

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3459.def: = person regarded as descendant of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}

H1568.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Makir<SDBH:מָכִיר>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► settler of the area on the east side of the {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}

H1581.def: = large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten

H5219.def: = viscous substance ◄ secreted by the Astragalus plant; ► used as medicine and as ingredient in food products

H6875.def: = dried resin produced by the liquidambar or lentisk terebinth tree; the sticky gray-brown gum is obtained by making cuts in the trunk of the tree; ► aromatic and medicinal, and highly valued in trade with Egypt

H3910.def: = a fragrant sticky juice from the hairy leaves of a low shrub; ◄ Cistus laurifolius (rock rose); ► its juice is hardened and ground for medicine and perfume

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

21.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H3459.def: = person regarded as descendant of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H4084.def: = descendant or inhabitant of {L:Midian<SDBH:מִדְיָן>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}

glosses: to move about freely > to trade
H5503.def: = action of moving from place to place ► to carry out activities of commerce

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H4900.def: = state in which humans are of more than average height{N:001}

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3130.def: = man; ◄ eleventh son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► father of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>} and {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}, each founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H3459.def: = person regarded as descendant of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H7205.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ first son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H7167.def: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands

H3801.def: = an undergarment, ◄ woven of linen, ► and worn by the High Priest and his fellow priests; it was worn over the {L:breeches<SDBH:מִכְנָס>}, but from the waist up it was next to the skin; it was a kind of shirt and probably had long sleeves and reached nearly to the ankles and was held in place by a sash wound around the waist.

H8163.def: = a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single {L:flock<SDBH:צֹאן>} with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten

H5795.def: = a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single {L:flock<SDBH:צֹאן>} with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten

H2881.def: = action by which part or all of an object is put into a liquid briefly and, in most cases, soon removed; ► often to absorb some of the liquid and apply it elsewhere

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3130.def: = man; ◄ eleventh son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► father of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>} and {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}, each founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H2963.def: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H7167.def: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands

H8071.def: = a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose-fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H3985.def: = state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H57.def: = pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4092.def: = descendant or inhabitant of {L:Midian<SDBH:מִדְיָן>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H6318.def: = man; ► official of king of {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}, who bought {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>} as a slave

H5631.def: = a male who has been castrated and made to serve in the women's quarters in the royal palace

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H2876.def: = person responsible for cooking, especially the preparation of meat
